title: ‘Jonas Mekas: The Camera Was Always Running’ Review: Honoring Experiments in Cinema
sub_head: The Jewish Museum explores the lengthy, prolific career of the avant-garde filmmaker who eagerly embraced accident.
body:
New York
‘Jonas Mekas: The Camera Was Always Running” at the Jewish Museum is probably best savored in morsels rather than swallowed in one gulp of time. A selective retrospective instead of an exhaustive one, it deftly reintroduces—on the centenary of his birth—a singular figure who for more than 60 years was a guiding spirit of avant-garde cinema in New York and the world.
